edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service

Interface ContainerService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    WapService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContainerServiceImpl

    public interface ContainerService
extends WapService
    The container interface to act as the bridge between the storage layer in the repositories and the REST request layer in the controllers.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteContainer(java.lang.String iri, java.lang.String etag)
      Deletes the Container denoted by the given IRI if ETags match A Container can only be deleted if it contains no sub-containers.
      Container getContainer(java.lang.String iri, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> preferences)
      Gets the Container denoted by the given IRI.
      Page getPage(java.lang.String containerIri, int containerPreference, int pageNr)
      Gets the Page with the given number of the Container denoted by the given IRI.
      Container postContainer(java.lang.String baseContainerIri, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String rawContainer, Format format)
      Creates a new Container with the given name as a child to the Container denoted by the baseContainerIri.

      • Methods inherited from interface edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service.WapService

        getAnnotation, isValidInputFormat

    • Method Detail

      • getContainer

        Container getContainer(java.lang.String iri,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> preferences)
                throws WapException
        Gets the Container denoted by the given IRI. Preferences are applied.
        Parameters:
        iri - The IRI of the container
        preferences - List of container preferences
        Returns:
        The requested Container
        Throws:
        WapException - in case any errors occurred

      • postContainer

        Container postContainer(java.lang.String baseContainerIri,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String rawContainer,
                        Format format)
                 throws WapException
        Creates a new Container with the given name as a child to the Container denoted by the baseContainerIri. The Container is serialized as a String in rawContainer with the given Format and constraints.
        Parameters:
        baseContainerIri - The IRI of the container to which the newly created one is added
        name - The name to use for the new container
        rawContainer - The serialized Container
        format - The provided format of the rawContainer
        Returns:
        The created Container
        Throws:
        WapException - In case any errors occurred

      • deleteContainer

        void deleteContainer(java.lang.String iri,
                     java.lang.String etag)
              throws WapException
        Deletes the Container denoted by the given IRI if ETags match A Container can only be deleted if it contains no sub-containers. Contained Annotations do not prevent deletion, they will get deleted too.
        Parameters:
        iri - The IRI of the container to delete
        etag - The ETag associated with the container state known to the client
        Throws:
        WapException - In case any errors occurred

      • getPage

        Page getPage(java.lang.String containerIri,
             int containerPreference,
             int pageNr)
      throws WapException
        Gets the Page with the given number of the Container denoted by the given IRI. Preference of Annotation representation is applied.
        Parameters:
        containerIri - The IRI of the container
        containerPreference - The preference regarding Annotation representation
        pageNr - The number of the page
        Returns:
        The requested Page
        Throws:
        WapException - In case any errors occurred
